FCParks.ParkFeatures: Bike and Hike Trail, Grills, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment
FCParks.ParkAbout: Berman Park is a unique facility. It is a linear park with a trail that is a link from South Washington Street to West Broad Street. The park is accessible to all the neighbors of the park and is heavily used. The open areas are large enough for small groups to kick a soccer ball around or play a game of catch, making it an ideal place for families and groups of friends to spend time together.

FCParks.ParkFeatures: Green Space, Grill, Park Benches, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Water Fountain
FCParks.ParkAbout: Big Chimneys Park has served the neighborhood well for over 25 years. Landscaped beds with an assortment of native plantings provide year-round color and natural beauty. The historical significance of the park and its name is highlighted and noted through interpretative signage. The small grass covered area in the middle of the park is great for informal games of catch or soccer.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 590 S. Maple Ave. or 200 W. Westmorland Rd, Falls Church, VA
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Basketball Court (Lighted), Bike and Hike Trail, Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Tennis Courts (2 - Lighted
FCParks.ParkAbout: Cavalier Trail Park, like many of the City’s parks, is a unique facility and an invaluable asset to the city. No other park in the city provides the same range of recreational experiences. One can enjoy tennis, basketball, walking, biking, birding, picnicking, swinging on a swing, or just sitting in the shade and relaxing.

FCParks.ParkFeatures: Basketball Court (Lighted), Grills, Horseshoe Court, Park Benches, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Tennis Court (two, both lighted), Volleyball, Water Fountain
FCParks.ParkAbout: Cherry Hill Park has been described as the “crown jewel” of the City’s Park system and as such it helps define the community. The park is invaluable to the city, as it is indeed the center of, and focal point for, most of the City’s special events and activities. It is the most heavily used park in the City of Falls Church because of its central location and many amenities.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 535 N. Van Buren St. or next to 100 Gresham Pl.
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Tables, Slide and Swings
FCParks.ParkAbout: Crossman Park is the only park of its kind in the City of Falls Church. No other park has the same array of natural features. Heavily wooded with a stream running through it, Crossman Park provides residents a unique opportunity to enjoy nature in an otherwise heavily urbanized area.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 311 East Broad St. or 108 North Fairfax St. Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Game Table, Gazebo, Grills, Horseshoe Court, Mini-Amphitheater, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Water Fountain, Interpretive Sinage
FCParks.ParkAbout: Donald Frady Park is a beautiful oasis located right off of East Broad Street. The park has a Victorian theme and a large playground. The centerpiece of the park is the large Gazebo and surrounding landscaping. Picnic tables and grills are available for residents to use.

FCParks.ParkAddress: North Roosevelt Street Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkFeatures: City Kiosk, Historic Trail Markers, Park Benches, Interpretive Sinage
FCParks.ParkAbout: Fort Taylor Park is a small park behind the Eden Center and next to Oakwood Cemetery. The park is well shaded and provides benches to sit on. The historic trail is marked with plaques about Fort Taylor and Taylor's Tavern.

FCParks.ParkName: Howard E. Herman Stream Valley Park
FCParks.ParkAddress: 601 West Broad St. or next to 434 Sherrow Ave. Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Hiking Trail, Biking Trail, City Kiosk
FCParks.ParkAbout: The Howard E. Herman Stream Valley Park is one of only two parks of its kind in the City of Falls Church. Crossman Park and the Howard E. Herman Stream Valley Park both offer a wide array of natural features. Heavily wooded with a stream running through it, the Howard E. Herman Stream Valley Park provides residents a unique opportunity to enjoy nature in an otherwise heavily urbanized area.

Larry Graves Park is co-owned and operated by both the City of Falls Church and Fairfax County. The Park offers a rectangular field that is scheduled by the city and two baseball diamonds that are scheduled by the County. Landscaping, mowing, maintenance, and trash removal are handled jointly between the two jurisdictions.

FCParks.ParkFeatures: Basketball Court, Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment
FCParks.ParkAbout: Lincoln Park is one of the City’s most popular parks and is located at the intersection of Great Falls Street and Lincoln Avenue. It is heavily used by neighbors of the park and by others who must drive or bike to the park. Lincoln Park was renovated in 2013 and now boasts the City’s only themed playground. The Forrest theme includes natural looking sculptures, a tree fort with slides, mushrooms to hop across and other natural looking amenities. Additionally, sculptures of squirrels, bears, raccoons and other animals are hidden in the play equipment for youth to find. The play equipment is shaded and the park also includes a small basketball court.

FCParks.ParkFeatures: Basketball Court, Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Water Fountain, Rectangular Athletic Field
FCParks.ParkAbout: Madison Park is a unique facility in that it is the only park in the City Of Falls Church with an athletic field. The park also features a sheltered picnic area, grills, a basketball court, and a playground area.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 100 block of W. Broad St., Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Chairs and tables, Lighting, Artificial turf
FCParks.ParkAbout: Mr. Brown Park was created by the Economic Development Authority (EDA). The EDA goals included: Activate Downtown Falls Church, Engage and connect with the community, Provide flexible design for various activities, Support local businesses

FCParks.ParkFeatures: Basketball Court, Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Water Fountain
FCParks.ParkAbout: Roberts Park is a unique facility that is widely used by both the community and the neighborhood. The playground is fenced in and contains a fitness area. The sheltered picnic area and grills are available for use by the community. The large open field and basketball court are utilized for pick-up games of soccer and basketball.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 106 Tinner Hill Rd. Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkAbout: Tinner Hill Historic Park is home to some of Falls Church's most interesting post Civil War history. There are historic markers scattered throughout the park as well as the Zig Zag Monument, which follows the original line of segregation in Falls Church. A covered pavilion is available for small group gatherings.

FCParks.ParkAddress: 1040 West Broad St., Falls Church, VA 22046
FCParks.ParkFeatures: Grills, Park Benches, Picnic Tables, Play Equipment, Skateboard and BMX Features
FCParks.ParkAbout: West End Park provides visitors a quiet, contemplative setting full of color and natural beauty created by landscape beds beaming with an assortment of native plantings. The small skate area is well utilized by the community as it is the only park in the City to feature a skate area.
